reviews.text: Very good and scenic campus with nice greenery making it very peaceful and lively place. They have a very old library cum museum which is a worth a visit. On top of that amazing computer science community and very good journalism department. Also univ has attached food street with extraordinary food joints. Definitely worth visiting once.
Bottom line is I live here and love it. It’s filled with smart, caring people in a beautiful setting. That said, the dogmatically liberal faculty and community makes doing business here a chore.

Exciting health fair on campus today from 11-2. Lots of great booths and programs. Parking is free in the Cobb deck. If you have time after the health fair there is a breath taking 3 story bookstore with a Starbucks. Get down here over 100 venders!

National championships, star athletes, star professors, smart students, beautiful campus, great school colors. What exactly is there NOT to like about this haven? Please, tell me! ..... I'm waiting! ...... And yeah, that's what I thought. Love this place.

Chinese and US scientists are creating human monkey hybrids. Researchers spliced human gene into monkey DNA. 

Researchers from the Kunming Institute of Zoology at the Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS), and the University of North Carolina in the United States modified the genes of 11 monkeys (eight first-generation and three second-generation) with the addition of copies of the human gene MCPH1.

This was a great experience to have as a non UNC basketball fan. The museum is full of rich history from player biographies, championship rings, and memories from past gland present glory. I especially liked the gym shoes on the court around the museum showing where all the great shots had been taken from. I went for an hour and I think that was an appropriate time in the museum. When you enter you will first watch a short video before entering the main room.
Love it! Great display of BB history and of course THE greatest college program. But, seriously,  the layout and way things are presented make for a fun look at the program over the years.

It is a great experience and is absolutely free! There is so many historical facts and donated items from previous players. It was nice and fun. The staff was helpful to answer any questions and were very kind.  Every Tarheel fan should visit!
Wow, just wow! A fabulous museum and what an incredible story. A very special experience.

I have lived in the triangle area for almost 6 years and just learned of the existence of this place.  Wonderful museum of UNC basketball history, and guess what???  Its FREE! One of the best things to me in the museum was a letter from Duke to one of UNC's most famous player...
Take my dog here all the time. Great place for a quick hike.
It’s a great place to wander I any kind of weather!
Great place to bike, walk, run and even photograph, especially in the fall
This place is beautiful and amazing!! The trails aren’t marked out super well but we didn’t get lost. It’s a defiant do over
Peaceful...

Amazing build your own burger restaurant.

The ground beef was seasoned perfectly for me.
I had them toss everything, aside from the kitchen sink on mine. All of the fixings were fresh and and tasty.
The fries were excellent.

Service was very good. The young man was eager to help, pleasant and appreciative.

Best Burgers! Craft your own burger or pick from their list of featured favorites. Try one of their special dipping sauces on either the burger or their fresh fries. They also have sweet potato fries if that's your thing! Love Buns!

I love the variety of their topping options and dipping sauces. Always slightly disappointed by the size/quality of the burger patty itself, but in my opinion the accoutrements make up for it. I'm a big fan of the fries, but only when I'm in the mood something greasy. A large basket can easily feed two or three people.
Amazing burger joint. Great build your own burgers with tasty buns and patties. High quality fries. Worth a try.

Great burgers, friendly staff, and good location. They have more size options than Al's Burger Shack, and the comparable single burger is cheaper--and I would say better, because of toppings. The caramelized onions are great, for example. Buns should get more recognition.

This place was amazing 20 years ago and still is great. I've been hoping to get back to Chapel Hill and come back. Much of Franklin Street has changed since then but Cosmic is still in the same alleyway with the same basic layout and same general menu. The food is still a great value though the prices have crept up. The portions are plentiful and everything is delicious.

I decided to order the Giant Burrito. Unfortunately, I didnt realize that it weighed 15 lbs. However, I made a commitment to myself as well as the United States of America to finish whatever food is put in front of me. I finished that entire burrito.... it tasted absolutely amazing. 11/10. I did it. I finished the entire damn thing. MERICA BABY
Guacamole was decent. Atmosphere is non-existent. It's fine.
Wholesome burritos cheap and fast. Can't go wrong with the regular veggie burrito, be sure to ask for some green sauce if you like a little extra spice.
Affordable and delicious! Staff is phenomenally friendly. I can't even guess how many burritos I've had here since moving to the Triangle. A local gem!

If you can, skip the car line, park, and walk up.  There seem to be plenty of parking spaces.  Car line backs up along Franklin.  The car line may be long, but it can move along, depending on orders.

So, is it worth the wait?  Yep.  Biscuits are absolutely delicious and cheap too.

Someone... please go here for me...
I miss this place!  Since having to go gluten free, this is definitely a place I put in the category of missing badly.  Not something you want to eat everyday (the amount of grease / liquid sunshine depending on who you're talking to) on the bag will tell you that.  But, oh my, their biscuits are amazing.
I use to grab one of their biscuits every Saturday AM and they were delicious.  Wish there was a gluten free option.
The staff is very friendly and the food reasonably priced. I tried their pork chop biscuit with egg and cheese and it was delicious! Highly recommend if you want good , fast and inexpensive.

I know each dish has the exact timing of when you should consume it.  When we ordered fried chicken biscuit sandwiches, we had to wait in the parking lot until they brought out perfect sandwiches.
Crisp golden brown biscuits with soft inside and crispy juicy chicken breast inside.
It was the rarest, most perfect timing with all the pieces aligned.

Congratulations!
Went here based off the reviews and I wasn’t impressed. Food was extremely greasy and a little pricey for what you get. The eggs was the best I tasted.

I’m from South Texas and my son had a college visit on Tuesday. Had never heard of time out, but when we went, it was a great place and the owner was a very nice and personable gentleman. I had the chicken cheddar biscuit, two thumbs up. It was around 9 AM when I visited. If I ever go back to chapel hill, I will go back to visit time out. Thank you very much for your hospitality.

As always time out provided a great meal. The food is always hot and very tasty. I love that this place is open 24/7. I recommend this place to anybody looking for some great pulled pork or chicken. The chicken breasts are also very juicy. The large biscuit they provide is also very fluffy and tasty.
Literally the best chicken biscuit I have ever had. They cook the chicken breast perfectly and pull out the bone when you order it.  Get the man vs food combo.  You will never regret it
Hot bar staples and competent breakfast. Coffee is meh, but the biscuits are on point. Friendly staff, and the prices can't be beat. Need a quick lunch or a late night meal? Do it!

I had the man v. food special at time out and it was great. The chicken was super moist and the biscuit wasn't super dry or overpowering. The mac and cheese tasted great as well. It was a cozy environment, although I will say that it wasn't the cleanest of places, but that doesn't really bother me.

Excellent dinner here! Service was on point at the bar and the one drink I had (Old Fashioned) was tasty. I started out with Tuscan Sausage Soup, which was very flavorful with the mustard greens in it. I then had the Grilled Pork Chop for dinner which was very good. It came with New Potatoes,  mushrooms, caramelized onions, pickled raisins and almonds. Sounds like it would be overly sweet, right? Not very much at all actually, as the flavors worked with each other quite well without one being too much. Good job on this one!

For dessert, I was a little unsure what to get. I didn't want something over the top sweet or too much of anything either. I opted for the Atlantic Beach Lemon-Lime pie after asking the bartender for ideas. I was not sure what to expect, especially with a saltine crust which was quite thick on the back of the slice. It was delicious! Great dessert with just enough of a tart to it to stave off the heat of the day. I didn't eat the entire crust, as it was a bit more stuck together at the back and I didn't want to make a huge mess.

All in all, great meal. As stated, service was on point and everyone I encountered there was very polite and engaging to make sure my experience was a good one. I can't speak to some of the negatives in other recent reviews, as this was my first time there, but I'll definitely be back to try a few different things when I'm in the area.

First heard of this spot through Our State magazine when I used their Atlantic Lemon Lime pie recipe for Thanksgiving. The pie was fantastic as were the other dishes my wife and I tried on our visit. Great staff who are obviously passionate about what they are serving. The space feels upscale but has a casual vibe. The menu is updated versions of down to earth comfort foods that we loved. As much as I loved the lemon pie I actually recommend the Good Banana Pudding for desert. Highly recommend this place.

Considering the restaurant is slightly upscale the prices were very reasonable.  I was also surprised by the portions- neither overly enourmous or stingy.  I had the shrimp with grits, and I was surprised to find quite a bit more than the half dozen shrimp most restaurants provide in a shrimp "meal."

The food was cooked perfectly and the flavor was divine. 

The menu is small, so it may be worth checking there's at least one dish you like if you're even a fairly picky eater.  But assuming there is, I have yet to experience a better restaurant in the triangle.

Highly highly recommended.

Crooks corner (New Orleans/Southern Cooking Fusion)is for SPICY hot food lovers. Food last year was really tasty, and spicy hot. Now its just spicy hot, flavor just wasn't there sadly. Owners retired recently...New ownership, we went a few days ago. Not fantastic, just okay. Hope new owners revamp, and find better cooking, menu, etc. 😟
Me and the husband love Crooks! We've been eating there for years and watched it change hands 3 times now. The food and service are always fantastic!

We enjoyed dining here.  The service is excellent and friendly.  Restaurant is clean and has a nice homey, cozy atmosphere.  Our order was quick and the food was good.  The breading on the fish, oysters, and scallops were nice and not thickly coated.  The vegetable medley was good too.  Not soggy or over cooked.  Just right.  Portions were good too for the price.  We will definitely be back.

Head to the front area of the bar (by the windows), order a peck of oysters with tabasco, lemon wedges, and melted butter...and enjoy.  Some steamed items are only available at the bar... Steamed oysters and clams done as you order them and served fast.  It's a great place to just hang out and place orders things in the direction your hunger and interests take you.  

The staff here is seriously talented on the steamer. If you like fresh steamed seafood, you won't be disappointed.

Nice dinner.  I had the feature: soft shell crab. The salad was really good, too. We started out with the calamari - delicious, especially with th he pesto aioli.  My dining companion had peel-and-eat shrimp and they were really good.

This restaurant is a favorite of mine, and it has been for over 13 years. Their raw oyster happy hour special (4pm to 6pm) is hard to beat. The parking lot accommodates just enough vehicles for a full restaurant, but there us usually room at the bar while you wait 15 minutes or less for your seat. Their entrees are excellent, and I recommend the horseradish crusted tilapia, but everything on the menu is great. Alcohol is reasonably priced. The draft selection is limited, but the liquor selection is vast. Great for families, date night, business, or a casual night out with friends. Constantly rated one of the best seafood restaurants in the Triangle.
Best seafood in the triangle, hands down. Keep an eye on the specials, but not much to complain about. Upscale but still casual and family friendly.
